title: Police disciplinary files (Skagit County Prosecutor's Office)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Skagit County Prosecutor's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

communications.subject: Your Skagit County, WA public records request #25-1232 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Skagit County, WA ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-1232 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting your request to Skagit County Records Department. Someone from our records team will respond as required by RCW 42.56.520, within five business days. ln calculating the five business days, the following are not counted: the day the county receives the request, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. RCW 1.12.040. See also WAC 44-14-03006. lf the request is received by the County after County business hours. the request shall be deemed to have been received by the county on the next business day. A response may be (a) providing the records, (b) providing a link to records available online, (c) providing a reasonable estimated date of when the records will be available, (d) requesting clarification, or (e) denial of the request. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact me at 360-416-1152, or by email at pherman@co.skagit.wa.us. Sincerely, Pamela Herman Certified Public Records Officer, Central Services Skagit County 360-416-1152 Public Records Act (PRA) Notice. Any information, including certain personal information, submitted to the County by e-mail or other method may be subject to disclosure as a public record under RCW chapter 42.56.  ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Skagit County, WA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center
